body_html:
Thanks for the note @tomMoral!

Note that the in "0.10.0rc0" the "rc" stands for "release candidate", which is a preliminary version cut before the actual 0.10 release, to shake out issues. Support for tf.svd was added after 0.10.0rc0 was cut, which is why it doesn't show up in your installs.

Try one of the following instead for either cpu or gpu installs:
https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl

Note that these are listed in the pip installation instructions for version 0.10. The instructions for master haven't been flipped over yet, since 0.10 hasn't been officially released yet.
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.10/get_started/os_setup.html#pip-installation

This should fix your problem; if not feel free to re-open.

body:
Thanks for the note @tomMoral!

Note that the in "0.10.0rc0" the "rc" stands for "release candidate", which is a preliminary version cut before the actual 0.10 release, to shake out issues.  Support for tf.svd was added after 0.10.0rc0 was cut, which is why it doesn't show up in your installs.

Try one of the following instead for either cpu or gpu installs: 
https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow-0.10.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl

Note that these are listed in the pip installation instructions for version 0.10.  The instructions for master haven't been flipped over yet, since 0.10 hasn't been officially released yet.
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.10/get_started/os_setup.html#pip-installation

This should fix your problem; if not feel free to re-open.
